intro: Tinopsis dissitiflora subsp. suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarezensis Tinopsis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in humid forest understories. Its floral structure features five petals and stamens, with a distinctive yellow-orange coloration. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
